author: Richard Innes
title: Sutton United goalkeeper Wayne Shaw offered job as Morrisons' official 'pie-taster'
text:
For the love of… (Photo: PA) Share Get Arsenal FC   Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
'Large man eats pie' wasn't the most likely big sport story of the day. 
And yet, Sutton United goalkeeper Wayne Shaw stuffing his face on the touchline during his side's 2-0 FA Cup defeat by Arsenal is now officially big, big news. 
It all started out as an innocent bit of fun - the 23-stone 'roly poly' keeper pictured wolfing down a pie as he sat on the bench, towards the end of the televised Fifth Round tie. It quickly escalated, as the 45 year-old was slammed by his own manager, interviewed on TV by Piers Morgan and placed under investigation by the Gambling Commission. A lot of fuss over a pie, eh? (Photo: REUTERS) 
However, we now have a bit of news which proves this story has reached new levels of absurdity. 
Morrisons - one of the biggest supermarket chains in Britain - have offered Shaw a job. An actual, proper job as their official pie-taster, with a salary of a year's worth of pies. 
*sigh* 
Morrisons’ Chief Pie Buyer Tessa Callaghan said: “We’re always looking for the best talent to taste our pies and make sure they hit the back of the net. Wayne Shaw, enjoying his new-found celebrity status (Photo: ITV) 
“Wayne’s performance last night sets him apart as one of the country’s most famous pie connoisseurs. 
“We were really impressed by his commitment to pie eating, and we understand that a good pie is the best way to warm up for any occasion, even if it is the biggest night of your football career."
